alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 3:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Dirt roadways may become muddy and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rainfall had ended, however, flooding remains possible while waters recede. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jeddito Wash and Tees Toh Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seba Dalkai, Tees Toh, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 382 and 388. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
